AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Government: Government whose defense counsel moved to suppress evidence obtained as a result of the stop and search of pickup truck camper, protecting all residents from arbitrary stops by governmental enforcement agents.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: Court handling post-trial procedures, determining the relevance and propriety of juror questioning, and making decisions on stops by immigration agents. This Court has repeatedly stated that a vital element of the Brignoni-Ponce standard is whether the agent had reason to believe that the pickup truck camper in question had come from the United States-Mexican border.
